DOC.brief_summary: This study assess initial feasibility GORE® EXCLUDER® Thoracoabdominal Branch Endoprosthesis ( TAMBE Device ) treatment Aortic Aneurysms Involving Visceral Branch Vessels .
DOC.brief_title: GORE® EXCLUDER® Thoracoabdominal Branch Endoprosthesis Treatment Type IV Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysms Involving Visceral Branch Vessels
DOC.criteria: 1 . Aortic aneurysm involve visceral vessel require treatment 2 . Adequate access TAMBE Device component 3 . Appropriate aortic anatomy receive TAMBE Device 4 . Age ≥ 18 year time inform consent signature 5 . Male infertile female 6 . The patient consider high risk open repair deem treat physician 7 . Capable comply protocol requirement , include followup 8 . An Informed Consent Form sign Subject legal representative Note : Additional Inclusion Criteria may apply 1 . Prior aortic surgery 2 . Ruptured leaking aortic aneurysm 3 . Aneurysmal dilatation due chronic aortic dissection 4 . Infected aorta 5 . Mycotic aneurysm 6 . Life expectancy < 2 year 7 . Myocardial infarction stroke within 6 week treatment 8 . Systemic infection may increase risk endovascular graft infection 9 . Degenerative connective tissue disease , e.g . Marfan 's EhlerDanlos Syndrome 10 . Participation another drug medical device study within 1 year study enrollment 11 . History drug abuse , e.g . cocaine amphetamine alcohol , within 1 year treatment 12 . Tortuous stenotic iliac / femoral artery inability use conduit vascular access 13 . Known sensitivity allergy device material 14 . Previous instance Heparin Induced Thrombocytopenia type 2 ( HIT2 ) know hypersensitivity heparin 15 . Patient body habitus medical condition prevents adequate fluoroscopic CT visualization aorta 16 . Renal Insufficiency Note : Additional Exclusion Criteria may apply
